sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Lives of Saints and Romances
Ailredi Vita S. Edwardi. Eadmeri Vita Anselmi. Apollonius Tyrius, etc.
msDesc.p: Vellum, 237 165 9.3 x 6.7, ff. 4 + 184 + 73 + 4, single and double columns, two volumes. Cent. xii, in the Christ Church hand or one modelled thereon.

Volume I: 25 lines to a page.
Volume II: Double columns of 36 and 26 lines.
Collation: a4 I8-XXIII8 || a8 b8 (4 canc.) c6 d8 e8 f8 (8 canc.) g8 h4 | i10 k8 (wants 8) | b4.

On f. iir a list of contents (xii): In hoc libro continentur hec opuscula. (1) Vita sancti eadwardi Regis et confessoris ... (11) Historia apollonii tyrii.
In red: Liber Sancti Andree apostoli de Rouecestria qui eum alienauerit anathema sit. Amen.

On iir some incomplete notes (xii):
Vel. ecce salus mundi
Salue summa salus. uerbum patris. hostia sacra
Viua caro. deitas integra. uerus homo.
Aue principium nostre creationis etc. in tabular form.
On iiv a list of chapters (1-24) of the Life of St Edward (xiii)
On f. ivv: Hic liber datus Mattheo Cantuar a decano roffensi.
At bottom of p. 1 on a slip replacing a cut-off margin: Liber de Claustro Roffensi. Per fratrem Willelmum de Cornubia monachum.
I do not find this book mentioned in the old catalogues Arch. Cant. VI, etc. and Royal MS. 2 B. XII.

msItem.head: Aelred of Rievaulx OCist, Vita Sancti Edwardi regis et confessoris

head.title: Eilredi Rievallensis abbatis vita sancti Edwardi regis et confessoris

msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus domini Eilredi rieuallensis abbatis de uita Sancti eadwardi Regis et confessoris pridie nonas Januarii
msItem.incipit: Multis ueterum studio fuisse didicimus
msItem.rubric: Explicit prologus
Incipit epistola aeilredi abbatis Rieuallis ad abbatum Laurentium Westmonasterii
msItem.incipit: Dilecto et diligendo et intimis uisceribus
msItem.rubric: Explicit epistola
Incipit vita beatissimi confessoris Christi aedwardi gloriosi regis anglorum
msItem.incipit: Gloriosi ac deo dilecti regis aedwardi uitam
msItem.ab: Ends
msItem.rubric: Explicit vita Sancti aedwardi regis
msItem.ab: In Twysden's Decem Scriptores, P. L. CXCV etc.

msItem.head: Eadmer of Canterbury OSB, Vita Sancti Anselmi
msItem.rubric: Incipit prefatio sequentis operis
msItem.incipit: Quoniam multas et antecessorum nostrorum temporibus
msItem.rubric: Explicit prefatio
Incipit liber primus de vita et conuersatione Anselmi Cantuariensis archiepiscopi
msItem.incipit: Instituta vite et conuersationis Anselmi
msItem.ab: Liber II
msItem.explicit: ad notitiam retributionis uite et conuersationis eius. sit itaque deo omnipotenti patri et filio et sancto Spiritui laus et gratiarum actio nunc et per omnia seculorum secula. amen
msItem.ab: See M. Rule, Eadmeri Historia, etc., p. lxxxviii, Rolls Series. He uses this MS. (which he calls C) for his text, printed in that volume

msItem.head: Gilbert Crispin OSB, Vita Herluini abbatis
msItem.incipit: Quoniam in re militari que quis memoratu digna egit
A danis qui normanniam primi obtinuere
msItem.ab: Ends p. 355 with the epitaph
msItem.explicit: Credere namque tuis hoc licet ex meritis
msItem.ab: App. ad Opp. Lanfranci 1648, p. 32, P. L. CL
Attributed to Gilbertus Crispinus, Abbot of Westminster

msItem.rubric: Incipit vita uenerabilis Bede presbiteri
msItem.incipit: Venerabilis domini famulus Beda presbiter et monachus natus est in prouincia northanhimbrorum
msItem.explicit: ipsius de semetipso dicta congruum subiungere uidetur
msItem.incipit: Ego inquit Beda famulus christi
msItem.explicit: quibus scriptura sancta contexta est. Cum ergo hos libros peruigili studio edidisset obiit. viimo kal. Junii. ... cuthbertus ... ad condiscipulum taliter scribens
msItem.incipit: Dilectissimo inquit in Christo collectori cuthwino
msItem.ab: No Anglo-Saxon passage occurs
msItem.rubric: Explicit uita uenerabili Bede presbiteri
msItem.ab: Printed by Whelock in the preface to his edition of the Historia, from this MS. Hardy I 454. Cf. Acta Sanctorum, May, VII 720

msItem.head: pseudo-Calixtus II (Guido of Burgundy), Liber Sancti Iacobi

head.title: Calixtus de miraculis et translatione sancti Jacobi cum epistola Leonis papae de eadem translatione

msItem.rubric: Incipit prefatio Calixti pape de miraculis Sancti Iacobi apostoli et de translatione corporis eius
msItem.incipit: Calixtus episcopus ... Heroibus famosissimis
msItem.rubric: Prologus Calixti pape super translatione Sancti Iacobi apostoli
msItem.incipit: Hanc beati Iacobi translationem a nostro codice excludere
Clericus quidam mihi notus
Post saluatoris nostri passionem
msItem.explicit: perhenniter manet in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.rubric: Epistola Leonis pape de translatione Sancti Jacobi apostoli
msItem.incipit: Noscat uestra fraternitas dilectissimi rectores
msItem.rubric: De tribus sollempnitatibus Sancti Iacobi
msItem.incipit: Beatus lucas euangelista in actibus
msItem.rubric: De miraculis Sancti Iacobi que Calixtus papa in unum collegit
msItem.incipit: Opere precium est beati Iacobi apostoli miracula
msItem.ab: Capitula
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber miraculorum Sancti Jacobi apostoli
msItem.incipit: Beatus Iacobus apostolus cum summa obedientie passionis dolorem
msItem.explicit: in his sacris sollempniis prestante domino nostro Ihesu Christo qui uiuit et regnat in secula. amen
msItem.rubric: Expliciunt miracula Sancti Jacobi apostoli
msItem.ab: See Acta Sanctorum, July, vol. VI 47

msItem.head: pseudo-Turpinus, Historia Caroli magni et Rolandi
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Turpini archiepiscopi Remensis quomodo karolus magnus rex francorum adquisiuit hispaniam. Hunc librum dicit Calixtus papa esse autenticum. Quomodo Sanctus Jacobus apostolus apparuit etc.
msItem.incipit: Gloriosissimus Christi apostolus Iacobus aliis apostolis
msItem.ab: Ends p. 454 (falling of wall at Grenoble)
msItem.explicit:
et est mirabile in oculis nostris.
Qui legis hoc carmen Turpino posce iuuamen. Ut pietate dei subueniatur ei
msItem.rubric: Explicit liber Turpini archiepiscopi de gestis regis karoli
msItem.ab: Cf. MS 292, MS 414

msItem.head: pseudo-Calixtus II (Guido of Burgundy), De inventione corporis Turpini

head.title: Calixtus papa de inventione corporis Turpini

msItem.rubric: Calixtus papa de inuentione corporis Turpini archiepiscopi et martiris
msItem.incipit: Beatus Turpinus remensis archiepiscopus christi martyr
msItem.rubric: De altumaiore cordube
msItem.incipit: De hoc quod nauari de uera prosapia non sunt geniti
msItem.ab: On these two items see H. L. D. Ward, Catalogue of Romances I 546 sqq.

head.title: Vita sanctae Theclae virginis et martiris

msItem.rubric: Incipit uita Sanctae Tecle uirginis et martyris
msItem.incipit: Tempore illo ascendente paulo ychonium post antiochie fugam facti sunt ei comites demas ermogenes et alexander erarius
msItem.ab: Ends
msItem.explicit: Et hec locuta profecta est seleutiam et multos ibi illuminauit et requieuit in beata pace. Deo gratias amen
msItem.ab: The beginning conforms to the version designated Ba by von Gebhardt (Lat. Übersetz. d. Acta Pauli et Theclae, Texte u. Unters. N. F. VII 2: 1902, p. 2): the conclusion is not exactly that of any version he gives, but is most like d. He does not mention this copy. Grabe, Spicilegium I 120 etc.
pp. 473 - 476 blank
(In the hand of no. 5)
msItem.incipit: In ciuitate antiochia rex fuit antiochus nomine a quo et ipsa ciuitas
msItem.rubric: Explicit
msItem.ab: Ed. Riese (Teubner, 1871): this copy is mentioned on p. vii
On p. 510, beginning of a late list of contents
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt capitula in vitam Anselmi archiepiscopi
